arm_group.description: Half of the oocytes of every donor will be vitrified with the Cryo Bio Systems High Security vitrification (CBSvit HS) device; the standard device in our lab.
Half of the oocytes of every donor will be vitrified with the Cryotop closed system (Cryotop SC).

brief_summary.textblock:
Donor sibling oocytes will be vitrified with two commercialy available devices. The first
      device is closed vitrification with closed storage and the second device is open
      vitrification with closed storage. Oocyte acceptors receive oocytes from both devices. With
      the increase in cooling rate generated by the open vitrification (second device), we expect
      to get an increase in survival rate of 10%.

clinical_study.brief_title: Oocyte Survival After Vitrification in an Open or Closed Device With Closed Storage.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Donor: ≤36 years old on day of oocyte retrieval

          -  Donor: ≥ 6 mature oocytes

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Donor: < 6 mature oocytes

clinical_study.official_title: Oocyte Survival After Vitrification in an Open or Closed Commercial Device: Study on Sibling Donor Oocytes.

primary_outcome.description: The purpose is to assess the survival rate of donor oocytes with the two vitrification devices.
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 6 days after every warming cycle

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: The purpose is to analyse the pre-implantation development of donor oocytes vitrified with two different devices.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 6 days after every warming cycle

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
